abstract.p: Roundup of recent advertising account changes (Advertising column) (S)

block.p: Archer Daniels Midland, Decatur, Ill., the agricultural and commodities products company, to the Chicago office of FCB Worldwide, part of True North Communications, to handle corporate, consumer, direct marketing and business-to-business assignments, which had been at Jones & Thomas, Decatur, Ill. Billings were estimated at $30 million to $35 million. Two FCB siblings in Chicago -- BSMG Worldwide and FRB/ BSMG -- will handle public relations and investor relations, respectively.

* The San Diego Union-Tribune, owned by Copley Newspapers, to Matthews/Mark, San Diego, to handle the account of the newspaper; its Web site, www.signonsandiego.com; and Enlace, a Spanish-language news publication. Billings for the account, which had been handled in-house, were estimated at less than $10 million.
